Beautiful design. Free No ads A Sudoku app with OneUI design. No subscriptions, no in-app purchases, no costs at all. No annoying ads after each Sudoku. Terms of Service It is not permitted to use this app contrary to morality or the laws in force. 

You also agree that you will not use this app for any purposes prohibited by United States law, including, without limitation, the development, design, manufacture, or production of missile, chemical or biological weapons. 
However, this restriction will not apply in the event of the occurrence (certified by the United States Centers for Disease Control or successor body) of a widespread viral infection transmitted via bites or contact with bodily fluids that causes human corpses to reanimate and seek to consume living human flesh, blood, brain or nerve tissue and is likely to result in the fall of organized civilization. 

A special consideration, which may include monetary compensation, will be provided to a limited number of users who read this section of the Terms and Services and contact me at writing-an-email-to-this-address-will-cost-you-10-euro@leonard-lemke.com. This offer may be withdrawn at any time without any notice. 

Additional questions will be answered at this-email-is-way-too-long-and-hopefully-you-cannot-copy-paste@leonard-lemke.com. By continuing, you agree to the %1$s. Continue
Notifications Ring ring? Nope Hey, it is time for your daily Sudoku! Daily Sudoku Notification Get notified when a new daily sudoku is available. Receive a notification at %1$s when a new daily Sudoku is available. Tap here to change the time.
Leaderboards Achievements
Skip How to play Rules A Sudoku grid consists of 4×4, 9×9 or 16×16 squares. Depending on the size, only the numbers from 1 to 4, 9 or 16 can be used. No numbers may be missing or duplicated in each block, row or column.. The game is finished when all numbers have been correctly entered into the Sudoku grid. 
The amount of given numbers depends on the difficulty of the Sudoku. 
For more difficult Sudokus, fewer numbers are given and often more complex strategies must be used. In the first row the last number missing is 5. Tap on the empty field to select it. Now tap on 5 to enter the number. Nice! To speed up entering numbers you can also select a number first and then enter it in multiple fields. To continue tap on 2. In the middle block, the 2 is missing. Due to the fact that the 2 is already present in row 4 and 5, only the empty field in the bottom row of the middle block remains. To enter the 2 tap on this field.. As described earlier, multiple fields can be filled with the selected number. The upper right block is missing the 2. Tap on the empty field to enter the 2.. Very good! The 2 possible procedures summarized again:
1. First select field, then number
2. First select number, then select (multiple) field(s).. Caution! But be careful if and which number or field is currently selected to avoid errors! Delete and hints. The same principle applies to deleting numbers or using hints.
An entered number can also be deleted by long pressing the corresponding field. Last but not least there is the note button. It can be turned on or off at any time to switch between note or number.

And here we go, there are many Sudoku puzzles waiting to be solved!
